title: October 20th connection to gmail stopped working
content:
I have 2 gmail accounts. My main one stopped working, my play one is working OK. I looked at passwords and notived there was an entry oauth.... for my play account, but not for my main account. Checked Account settings and both were set to oauth2

I deleted passwords for both accounts, set them both to not oauth2 and then set my main one to oauth2. of course now I have no passwords, but my connection to Googlemail which after asking me for a password ended with the screen attached
creator: audreyledbrook

title: Getting TLS error - can't send or receive - gmail, outlook, yahoo - all bad
content:
I have switched to work remotely and have transferred all my Thunderbird settings from my PC to my laptop.

I got to my new remote work place and can't receive any emails using my accounts set up in Thunderbird.

It is the same whether I use Gmail, Outlook or Yahoo.

I have tried many things but basically have taken all defaults for setting up email accounts. I am using Windows 11 Home and I am not going through a VPN. My Thunderbird version is 115.3.3 (64-bit)

For example for Gmail I get:

Non-overridable TLS error occurred. Handshake error or probably the TLS version or certificate used by server imap.gmail.com is incompatible.

You can see a screen print here: https://imgur.com/a/KDHtSP9

Am I doing something wrong?
creator: boliche.elresorte

title: ALL MAIL folder
content: I have over 14000 messages in my ALL MAIL folder and don't know how to delete them, as they come back on when I try to delete them.
